project.name: Ember Light Table
project.description: Lightweight, component based table for Ember 2.x

Usage.name: Usage
Usage.description:
## Installation
```shell
ember install ember-light-table
```

## Looking for help?
If it is a bug [please open an issue on GitHub](http://github.com/offirgolan/ember-light-table/issues).

## Usage
There are two parts to this addon. The first is the [Table](../classes/Table.html) which you create with column definitions and rows, and the second is the component declaration.

Table Declaration.name: Table Declaration

Component Declaration.name: Component Declaration

props.name: enableSync
props.description:
If `true`, creates a two way sync
          between the table's rows and the passed rows collection. Also see
          `setRowsSynced(rows)`.

props.name: rowOptions
props.description:
Options hash passed through to
          `createRow(content, options)`.

light-table.name: light-table

t.body.name: t.body

t.foot.name: t.foot

t.head.name: t.head

fixProto.name: fixProto
fixProto.description:
Internet Explorer <= 10 has no support for `__proto__`.
This conditional polyfill works around that, so that static methods like
`reopen` may be used. There are some caveats though.

For more information, please see: [Issue #436 (comment)][436]

[436]: https://github.com/offirgolan/ember-light-table/issues/436#issuecomment-310138868

classitems.description:

CSS Classes:

   - `drag-left`
   - `drag-right`

Whether the column is sorted.

classitems.description: Column header label
classitems.name: label

classitems.description: Text alignment. Possible values are ['left', 'right', 'center']
classitems.name: align

classitems.description: The minimum width (in px) that this column can be resized to.
classitems.name: minResizeWidth

classitems.description:
The parent column (or group) for this sub-column.
This will only have a value if this column is a sub-column.
Note: this doesn't update if you move this sub-column to another parent after instantiation.
classitems.name: parent

classitems.description: An array of sub columns to be grouped together
classitems.name: subColumns

classitems.description:
An array of media breakpoints that determine when this column will be shown

If we have the following breakpoints defined in `app/breakpoints.js`:

- mobile
- tablet
- desktop

And we want to show this column only for tablet and desktop media, the following
array should be specified: `['tablet', 'desktop']`.

If this property is `null`, `undefined`, or `[]`, then this column will always
be shown, regardless of the current media type.
classitems.name: breakpoints

classitems.description:
Type of column component

You can create your own column types by running the blueprint:
`ember g column-type my-column-type`

This will generate a component for you which represents the `<th>`
element for the column. If you want to apply custom actions to the `th`,
or do some custom styling of the `th` with classNameBindings, all of that is
available to you in this component.

You can then specify the custom type you created as a string here, to use it.
classitems.name: type

classitems.description:
Type of cell component

You can create your own cell types by running the blueprint:
`ember g cell-type my-cell-type`

This will generate a component for you which represents the `<td>`
cells in the column. If you want to apply custom actions to the `td`,
or do some custom styling of the `td` with classNameBindings, all of that is
available to you in this component.

You can then specify the custom type you created as a string here, to use it.
classitems.name: cellType

classitems.description: Component name for the column
classitems.name: component

classitems.description:
Component name for the column cells. This component is automatically passed row,
column, and value variables, and you can specify a valuePath to set what property
the value is set to.
classitems.name: cellComponent

classitems.description: Class names to be applied to header and footer cells of this column
classitems.name: classNames

classitems.description: Class names to be applied to all cells of this column
classitems.name: cellClassNames

classitems.description:
A format function used to calculate a cell's value. This method will be passed
the raw value if `valuePath` is specified.
classitems.name: format

classitems.description: Column's unique ID.
classitems.name: columnId

classitems.description: True if `hidden` or `responsiveHidden` is true.

classitems.description:
Whether the row is hidden.

classitems.description:
Whether the row is expanded.

Whether the row is selected.

classitems.description: Class names to be applied to this row
classitems.name: classNames

classitems.description:
Data content for this row. Since this class extends Ember.ObjectProxy,
all properties are forwarded to the content. This means that instead of
`row.content.foo` you can just do `row.foo`. Please note that methods are
not forwarded. You will not be able to do `row.save()`, instead, you would have
to do `row.content.save()`.
classitems.name: content

classitems.description:
Rows's unique ID.

Note: named `rowId` in order to not shadow the `content.id` property.
classitems.name: rowId

classitems.description: Replace all the row's content with content of the argument. If argument is an empty array rows will be cleared.
classitems.name: setRows

classitems.description:
The same as `setRows`, however the given array is synced, meaning that
mutating the array also updates the table and vice-versa.

Also see `enableSync` in the constructor options.
classitems.name: setRowsSynced

classitems.description: Push the object onto the end of the row array if it is not already present.

classitems.name: removeRow

classitems.description: Removes each object in the passed enumerable from the rows.
classitems.name: removeRows

classitems.description: Remove a row at the specified index
classitems.name: removeRowAt

classitems.description: Replace all the column's content with content of the argument. If argument is an empty array columns will be cleared.

classitems.description: Table height.
classitems.name: height

classitems.description: Class names that will be added to all <table> tags
classitems.name: tableClassNames

classitems.description: Enable responsive behavior
classitems.name: responsive

classitems.description:
A hash to determine the number of columns to show per given breakpoint.
If this is specified, it will override any column specific breakpoints.

If we have the following breakpoints defined in `app/breakpoints.js`:

- mobile
- tablet
- desktop

The following hash can be passed in:

```js
{
 mobile: 2,
 tablet: 4
}
```

If there is no rule specified for a given breakpoint (i.e. `desktop`),
all columns will be shown.
classitems.name: breakpoints

classitems.description:
Toggles occlusion rendering functionality. Currently experimental.
If set to true, you must set {{#crossLink 't.body/estimatedRowHeight:property'}}{{/crossLink}} to
something other than the default value.
classitems.name: occlusion

classitems.description:
Estimated size of a row. Used in `vertical-collection` to determine roughly the number
of rows exist out of the viewport.
classitems.name: estimatedRowHeight

classitems.description: Table component shared options
classitems.name: sharedOptions

classitems.description:
Calculates the total width of the visible columns via their `width`
propert.

Returns 0 for the following conditions
 - All widths are not set
 - Widths are not the same unit
 - Unit cannot be determined
classitems.name: totalWidth

classitems.description:
onBeforeResponsiveChange action.
Called before any column visibility is altered.
classitems.name: onBeforeResponsiveChange

classitems.description:
onAfterResponsiveChange action.
Called after all column visibility has been altered.
classitems.name: onAfterResponsiveChange

classitems.description:
Allows a user to select a row on click. All this will do is apply the necessary
CSS classes and add the row to `table.selectedRows`. If `multiSelect` is disabled
only one row will be selected at a time.
classitems.name: canSelect

classitems.description:
Select a row on click. If this is set to `false` and multiSelect is
enabled, using click + `shift`, `cmd`, or `ctrl` will still work as
intended, while clicking on the row will not set the row as selected.
classitems.name: selectOnClick
canExpand

classitems.description:
Allows a user to select multiple rows with the `ctrl`, `cmd`, and `shift` keys.
These rows can be easily accessed via `table.get('selectedRows')`
classitems.name: multiSelect

classitems.description:
When multiSelect is true, this property determines whether or not `ctrl`
(or `cmd`) is required to select additional rows, one by one. When false,
simply clicking on subsequent rows will select or deselect them.

`shift` to select many consecutive rows is unaffected by this property.
classitems.name: multiSelectRequiresKeyboard

classitems.description: Hide scrollbar when not scrolling
classitems.name: autoHideScrollbar

classitems.description: Allows multiple rows to be expanded at once
classitems.name: multiRowExpansion

classitems.description: Expand a row on click
classitems.name: expandOnClick

classitems.description:
If true, the body block will yield columns and rows, allowing you
to define your own table body
classitems.name: overwrite

classitems.description:
If true, the body will prepend an invisible `<tr>` that scaffolds the
widths of the table cells.

ember-light-table uses [`table-layout: fixed`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/table-layout).
This means, that the widths of the columns are defined by the first row
only. By prepending this scaffolding row, widths of columns only need to
be specified once.
classitems.name: enableScaffolding

classitems.description: ID of main table component. Used to generate divs for ember-wormhole
classitems.name: tableId

classitems.description:
Set this property to scroll to a specific px offset.

This only works when `useVirtualScrollbar` is `true`, i.e. when you are
using fixed headers / footers.
classitems.name: scrollTo

classitems.description:
Set this property to a `Row` to scroll that `Row` into view.

This only works when `useVirtualScrollbar` is `true`, i.e. when you are
using fixed headers / footers.
classitems.name: scrollToRow
rowComponent
spannedRowComponent
infinityComponent

classitems.description: onRowClick action. Handles selection, and row expansion.
classitems.name: onRowClick

classitems.description: onRowDoubleClick action.
classitems.name: onRowDoubleClick

classitems.description:
onScroll action - sent when user scrolls in the Y direction

This only works when `useVirtualScrollbar` is `true`, i.e. when you are
using fixed headers / footers.
classitems.name: onScroll

classitems.description: onScrolledToBottom action - sent when user scrolls to the bottom
classitems.name: onScrolledToBottom

classitems.description:
Array of Columns indicating where the column can be potentially dragged.
If the column is part of a group (has a parent column), this will be all of the columns in that group,
otherwise it's all of the columns in the table.
classitems.name: dragColumnGroup

classitems.description: Resize all cells in the column instead of just the header / footer
classitems.name: resizeOnDrag

classitems.description: CSS classes to be applied to an `` tag that is inserted into the column's `` element when the column is sortable but not yet sorted. For instance, if you have installed `ember-font-awesome` or include the `font-awesome` assets manually (e.g. via a CDN), you can set `iconSortable` to `'fa fa-sort'`, which would yield this markup: ``
classitems.name: iconSortable

classitems.description: See `iconSortable`. CSS classes to apply to `` when the column is sorted ascending.
classitems.name: iconAscending

classitems.description: See `iconSortable`. CSS classes to apply to `` when the column is sorted descending.
classitems.name: iconDescending

classitems.description: Custom sorting component name to use instead of the default `` template. See `iconSortable`, `iconAsending`, or `iconDescending`.
classitems.name: iconComponent

classitems.description: ID of main table component. Used to generate divs for ember-wormhole
onColumnClick action. Handles column sorting.
classitems.name: onColumnClick

classitems.description: onColumnDoubleClick action.
classitems.name: onColumnDoubleClick

classitems.name: onColumnResized

params.description: The column that is being dragged

params.description: The column was successfully dropped and sorted

classitems.description:
Whether or not this environment supports `__proto__`.
IE <= 10 is known to not support it-

More information on `__proto__`:

  https://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object/proto
classitems.name: isProtoSupported

classitems.description:
Assigns all properties of `defaults` to `obj`, if they are not already
defined on `obj`. This means that `obj` is mutated in place.

Taken from:

  https://github.com/babel/babel/blob/64eafad472ebac6333671fff65a9669739e6cd88/packages/babel-helpers/src/helpers.js#L287-L299
classitems.name: defaults

params.name: obj
params.description: The object to assign the default properties to

params.name: defaults
params.description:
The object that provides all default properties to
                          be assigned

classitems.description:
Conditionally attempt to polyfill support for `__proto__` in environments
that do not support it.

If `__proto__` is not supported, this function assigns all properties and
methods pf `Class.__proto__` to `Class` itself.
classitems.name: fixProto
